alert.note: Alert for Coweta; Fayette; Spalding (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 5:43PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Line Creek near Senoia affecting Coweta, Fayette and Spalding Counties. For the Flint River Basin...including Americus, Peachtree City, Lovejoy, Fayetteville, Peachtree City, Woolsey, Sharpsburg, Peachtree City, Peachtree City, Senoia, Griffin, Orchard Hill, Griffin, Thomaston, Molena, Carsonville, Montezuma, Byromville... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Line Creek near Senoia. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding of the natural flood plain begins which primarily affects agricultural and wooded areas. A small dirt utility access road near the Georgia Highway 85 bridge goes underwater. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 PM EST Tuesday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 09/17/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 545 AM EST.
